summary: This document is a Twitter post from July 8, 2019, by user DougScott357, referencing a thread about crimes and expressing hope that they will be the deciding force behind an attack on young women and girls. It tags Sarah Silverman and references a link to another Twitter thread.

persons.name: Doug Scott
persons.role: Twitter user, Former USAF Tactical Aircraft Maintenance Specialist
persons.context: Author of the Twitter post, identifies as a former USAF maintenance specialist and part of the #Resistance movement.

persons.name: Sarah Silverman
persons.context: Tagged in the Twitter post, referenced by her Twitter handle @SarahKSilverman.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Referenced in the post with the handle @realDonaldTrump, questioning if crimes will be what people turn on him for.

connections.description: Doug Scott references Donald Trump in a critical context, questioning if crimes will be what people turn on him for.
Doug Scott tags Sarah Silverman in the Twitter post, directing her to read a thread.

events.title: Twitter post about crimes and Trump
events.description: Doug Scott posts on Twitter questioning if crimes will be what people turn on Donald Trump for, referencing a sick and perverted attack on young women and girls.

keyFacts: The document is a Twitter post from July 8, 2019, by DougScott357.
It questions if crimes will be what people turn on Donald Trump for.
It references a sick and perverted attack on young women and girls.
It tags Sarah Silverman and includes a link to another Twitter thread.
The user identifies as a former USAF Tactical Aircraft Maintenance Specialist from Connecticut, USA.
